item.title: The Dubai Chamber has announced the launch of the Dubai Smartpreneur Competition for 2017
item.description:
The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry, working with the Smart Dubai Office, launched the second annual Dubai Smartpreneur Competition. This aligns with the vision of His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, UAE Vice President and Prime Minister, and Ruler of Dubai, to make Dubai a leading smart city. Source: Dubai Chamber. The event featured a panel discussion about the UAE government’s progress on smart city and innovation initiatives, and what will drive future sustainable growth...

item.title: KKday has launched in Singapore and is introducing the #taiwantrippin promotion
item.description:
Source: KKday. Ming Chen, CEO of Asia’s leading travel experience e-commerce platform KKday celebrates Singapore launch, and the #taiwantrippin digital campaign. KKday, an Asian e-commerce platform specializing in travel experiences, has launched in Singapore. Based in Taiwan, KKday links users with local tours globally. Following its 2014 debut, KKday expanded to Hong Kong, Korea, and Japan, with Singapore as its fourth market. “Establishing a presence in Singapore was a logical step...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/kkday-has-launched-in-singapore-and-is-introducing-the-taiwantrippin-promotion/

item.title: Widgets for Charity
item.description:
The holiday season is a time for giving, and this year, technology is making it easier than ever to support causes we care about. “America’s Giving Challenge,” a contest using “charity badges,” harnesses the power of social networks and the internet to raise money for charities. The contest is backed by Kevin Bacon, who is known for his association with the “six degrees of separation” concept. His website, SixDegrees.org, supports celebrity charities and promotes the Charity Badge...

item.title: The winners of Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 in Singapore have been announced
item.description:
Source: The Ascendas-Singbridge Group. From left: Ho Kheng Lian, Venture Partner, Vectr Ventures; Natalie Loh, Vice President of Products, Vanitee; Kuik Xiao Shi, Co-Founder, Vanitee; Pocket Sun, Founding Partner of SoGal Ventures; Adrianna Tan, Founder, Wobe; Virginia Tan, Co-founder and Managing Director of Lean In China; Adeline Quek, Head of Regional Business Development, Grabtaxi; Mrs Nina Yang, Chief Operating Officer of Singbridge. The Ascendas-Singbridge Group selected two startups from Singapore to compete in the finals of the Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 competition...

item.title: The RYDE Carpool Challenge will begin in April
item.description:
Singapore’s carpooling app, RYDE, has teamed up with Cycle & Carriage for the RYDE Carpool Challenge. The grand prize? A Mitsubishi Attrage. The eight-month campaign, which began on April 1, 2016, aims to have RYDE users complete a collective carpool distance of 1,000,000km, thus reducing carbon emissions by 200,000kg. By encouraging carpooling, RYDE hopes to promote a more environmentally friendly mode of transportation. Each month, RYDE will select two winners: the rider and driver with the highest number of successful carpools...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-ryde-carpool-challenge-will-begin-in-april/

item.title: Huawei P9 and India Photo Project introduce Monochrome award in India
item.description:
Source: Instagram. Top Instagram posts for the contest hashtag #ipp_ma2016 at the time of writing. Huawei, in partnership with the Instagram-based India Photo Project, has introduced the “Monochrome” award to commemorate World Photography Day on August 19th. This competition, running from August 20th to August 31st, aims to discover India’s top black and white Instagram photographer. The judging panel comprises Sumit Dayal, recognized as CNN’s Indian Instagrammer of the Year in 2015, Tara Bedi, the first Instagram employee from India, Devika Daulet Singh, Director of PHOTOINK, a prominent photography gallery, and Neeraj Priyadarshini, the Photo Editor at the Indian Express...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/huawei-p9-and-india-photo-project-introduce-monochrome-award-in-india/

item.title: The deadline for submissions to the Sony World Photography Awards 2019 is January 2019
item.description:
Global photographers have less than a month to submit their entries to the 12th annual Sony World Photography Awards’ Professional, Open and Youth competitions. Considered a major event in the photography world, the awards acknowledge the finest contemporary photography from the past year across a diverse range of photographic genres. Scott Gray, the CEO and founder of the World Photography Organisation, remarked that each year, the Sony World Photography Awards brings new photographic talents to light and provides established artists with a global stage for their work...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-deadline-for-submissions-to-the-sony-world-photography-awards-2019-is-january-2019/

item.title: Celcom users have the opportunity to participate in the Hear Forever promotion on Yonder Music and have a chance to win cash prizes
item.description:
Source: Yonder Music. Graphic for the Hear Forever campaign. Until August 18, 2016, Yonder Music Malaysia is running a promotion, awarding RM500 daily to the Celcom subscriber who uses the Yonder Music app most actively. The user with the highest daily engagement wins the cash prize. Daphne Lourdes, Yonder Music’s Country Manager for Malaysia, stated that Yonder Music consistently seeks new ways to interact with users and provide them with constant access to all their favorite music...

item.title: Changi Airport introduces a new reward for the Be a Changi Millionaire campaign
item.description:
Source: Changi Airport Group. This year’s Be a Changi Millionaire competition offers a chance to win a Volvo sedan as well. Changi Airport has enhanced its well-known *Be a Changi Millionaire*_ retail promotion this year by adding a new prize: a Volvo S90 T5 luxury sedan. This is in addition to the existing S$1 million cash prize. According to Changi Airport, this is the largest retail promotion at any airport globally...

item.title: Tickets for the Nathan Hartono showcase are now available through Singtel
item.description:
Source: Singtel. Nathan Hartono recently held a live performance on Singtel’s Facebook page. Nathan Hartono’s performance video, broadcasted on Singtel’s Facebook page last week, has garnered over 99,000 views and is still climbing. This event is a continuation of Singtel’s Christmas tradition of giving back to the community and supporting the Singtel Touching Lives Fund. During the event, organized by Singtel to celebrate the festive season and spread generosity, fans could interact with Hartono and request song dedications for their loved ones...

item.title: Participate in the Singapore Mother's Day contest for a chance to win a Huawei P20 in Pink Gold
item.description:
Source: Huawei Mobile Singapore Facebook page. Watch the video In Singapore, Huawei’s Consumer Business Group is holding a contest in celebration of Mother’s Day (May 13th), ending on May 24th. To participate, Singaporean residents simply need to comment on the contest video found on the Huawei Mobile Singapore Facebook page. The comment should answer the question: “What lengths would your mother go to for you?” and include the hashtag #SeeMooore...

item.title: The Canon PhotoMarathon is scheduled to take place in Singapore in November
item.description:
Source: Canon eDM. Now in its 12th year, the Canon PhotoMarathon 2014 is the biggest photography competition in the region. Taking place in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Vietnam, India, Thailand, and Cambodia, the competition offers a fantastic chance for companies to form teams and compete in the Corporate Challenge category. Companies can participate by assembling a team of at least three individuals who register as a group. In contrast to the open and student divisions, corporate teams are evaluated collectively...

item.title: In May 2015, Digi prepaid customers have the chance to win smartphones, tablets, and cars
item.description:
Source: Digi. Thrane. Digi Telecommunication (Digi) is celebrating its 20th anniversary by giving back to its prepaid customers. Throughout May, Digi will be offering prizes like smartphones, tablets, and even cars. From May 1st to May 31st, customers who top-up their prepaid credit are eligible to win prizes. Every day, 20 smartphones will be given away, with 200 tablets awarded weekly. Two lucky winners will even drive home a Ford Ranger...

item.title: Sony has introduced the Picture This Festival for the Planet competition
item.description:
Sony Pictures Television Networks (SPTN), working with the United Nations Foundation, has launched the Picture This Festival for the Planet. The short-film competition encourages emerging filmmakers, storytellers, and changemakers globally to share their visions for a positive future for the planet. Representing over 70 countries, participants are invited to submit videos inspired by the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The SDGs are a collection of global goals adopted by the United Nations to address poverty, protect the planet, and promote prosperity for everyone...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/sony-has-introduced-the-picture-this-festival-for-the-planet-competition/

item.title: The 5-Min Video Challenge has been introduced by the Singtel Group
item.description:
Source: The 5-Min Video Challenge website. Invitation to enter the local rounds. Singtel Group launched The 5-Min Video Challenge to promote creative content across its global markets. The competition is a collaborative effort among Singtel’s associates, including Optus, AIS, Airtel, Globe, and Telkomsel. Winning videos will be shared with over 600 million customers within the Singtel Group. Content creation is a key element of the Group’s strategy for customer engagement in a world where mobile devices are everywhere and demand for online video entertainment is high...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-5-min-video-challenge-has-been-introduced-by-the-singtel-group/

item.title: The winners of Canon PhotoMarathon XVI 2018 have been revealed
item.description:
The winners of the 16th Canon PhotoMarathon XVI 2018 in Singapore have been revealed. This annual photography competition, being the largest in the region, challenges photography enthusiasts to test their skills under a time constraint. A new challenge category, ‘dusk,’ was introduced this year, allowing participants to capture a blend of daytime and nighttime scenes. Here is a list of the winners: Best Of Show - Student: Timothy John Low Wen, Nanyang Polytechnic Best Of Show - Open: Azril Azam Bin Abdul Rahim Team Category Winner: ORBIGUD School Challenge Winner: Anglo-Chinese School (Independent) Theme 1: Solitude Student Category 1st: Myo Thi Ha Kyaw, Nanyang Technological University 2nd: Evita Lee Ann Hwee, Christ Church Secondary School 3rd: Ong Yi Feng Jayden, Edgefield Secondary School Open Category 1st: Aht Yomyai 2nd: Zhang Dongli 3rd: Ahmad Iskandar Bin Abdullah Theme 2: Simplicity Student Category 1st: Jessie Chia, National University Of Singapore 2nd: Timothy John Low Wen, Nanyang Polytechnic 3rd: Teo Xu Kai, Temasek Polytechnic Open Category 1st: Ong Kah Hong 2nd: Azril Azam Bin Abdul Rahim 3rd: Siyuan Ma Canon Challenge Winner: Shrirang Rajaram Nirgun Theme 3: Glow Student Category 1st: Lester Thomas Daniel, Singapore Polytechnic 2nd: Mikaela Gn, Anglo-Chinese School (Independent) 3rd: Benjamin Tay Tze Min, Hwa Chong Institution Open Category 1st: Nursanto Soeradi Somo 2nd: Gerdie Hutomo 3rd: Mai Hung Son ..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-winners-of-canon-photomarathon-xvi-2018-have-been-revealed/

item.title: Improve your filmmaking abilities using a smartphone
item.description:
Boo (left) with Tan (right). While using mobile phones for filmmaking only emerged around 2008, recent technological advancements have empowered many phone owners to become filmmakers. Huawei’s first film awards, the HUAWEI Film Awards (HFA), aim to raise awareness about this potential in the Asia Pacific region and cultivate local talent. Their latest phone, the HUAWEI Mate 30 Pro, boasts features like 4K video recording, ultra-wide angle lens, and ultra slow motion capabilities, making it a capable filmmaking tool...

item.title: Asia Miles has launched a new Facebook travel game specifically designed for travelers in Hong Kong
item.description:
Asia Miles members in Hong Kong have the opportunity to win 100,000 miles this month. To participate, visit the Asia Miles Facebook page and find the post featuring travel tips for Taipei from social media influencer Ming Jai (Ming 仔). Participants are asked to identify two Asia Miles categories that apply to Ming Jai’s itinerary. Then, they need to design an additional day of travel in Taipei with a budget of HK$5,000 or less, incorporating at least three categories for earning miles...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/asia-miles-has-launched-a-new-facebook-travel-game-specifically-designed-for-travelers-in-hong-kong/

item.title: Tata Communications announces Global Scrapbook Challenge ahead of upcoming Formula 1 race
item.description:
Tata Communications, a global communications company, has launched its second technology challenge offering US$50,000 in prizes. This challenge focuses on harnessing innovative connectivity solutions, a key aspect of Formula 1 racing. Leading up to the FORMULA 1 GRAN PREMIO D’ITALIA 2014, Tata Communications is challenging the public to create a digital scrapbook celebrating the history of the Mercedes-Benz Silver Arrows in Formula 1. This Global Scrapbook Challenge aims to build a virtual museum, a captivating online archive of stories, memories, and intrigue for fans of the sport...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/tata-communications-announces-global-scrapbook-challenge-ahead-of-upcoming-formula-1-race/

item.title: TikTok has introduced the #NDP2019 challenge to celebrate Singapore's National Day
item.description:
To commemorate Singapore’s 54th birthday, TikTok, the short-form video app, is launching a special hashtag challenge just for Singapore: #NDP2019. TikTok users in Singapore are invited to express their national pride using the country’s colors, red and white, in their videos. They can use special NDP stickers and add the #NDP2019 hashtag to their posts. Ten lucky users who participate will have the chance to win limited-edition National Day TikTok merchandise...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/tiktok-has-introduced-the-ndp2019-challenge-to-celebrate-singapore-s-national-day/

item.title: Enter for a chance to win a trip to Barcelona with UberHOLIDAY and Qatar Airways
item.description:
Source: Uber Malaysia. Qatar Airways will fly three lucky winners and their partners on a whirlwind trip to Spain. On January 12, 2017, Uber users in Malaysia have the opportunity to win an unforgettable trip to Barcelona, Spain through UberHOLIDAY. This promotion is a collaboration with the Qatar Airways Travel Festival 2017. Three winners and their partners will be chosen to receive a ride to the airport and flown to Barcelona on the same day, contingent upon having valid passports and meeting Spain’s visa requirements*...

item.title: The winners of the 2017 Sony World Photography Awards in Singapore have been announced
item.description:
Lester Koh Meng Hua has been named the winner of the Singapore National Award, as part of the world’s largest photography competition. Source: Sony. Singapore at dawn won the Singapore National Award for the Sony World Photography Awards 2017. The photograph titled Singapore at dawn by Lester Koh Meng Hua has been chosen by the judges of the 2017 Sony World Photography Awards as the winner of the Singapore National Award...
